client_id.title: Client ID
client_id.description: The Client ID of your Google Analytics developer application.

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: The Client Secret of your Google Analytics developer application.

refresh_token.title: Refresh Token
refresh_token.description: The token for obtaining a new access token.

access_token.title: Access Token
access_token.description: Access Token for making authenticated requests.

credentials_json.title: Service Account JSON Key
credentials_json.description: The JSON key of the service account to use for authorization

property_id.title: Property ID
property_id.description: A Google Analytics GA4 property identifier whose events are tracked. Specified in the URL path and not the body

date_ranges_start_date.title: Start Date
date_ranges_start_date.description: The start date from which to replicate report data in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Data generated before this date will not be included in the report. Not applied to custom Cohort reports.

custom_reports.title: Custom Reports
custom_reports.description: A JSON array describing the custom reports you want to sync from Google Analytics. See the docs for more information about the exact format you can use to fill out this field.

window_in_days.title: Data request time increment in days
window_in_days.description: The time increment used by the connector when requesting data from the Google Analytics API. More information is available in the the docs. The bigger this value is, the faster the sync will be, but the more likely that sampling will be applied to your data, potentially causing inaccuracies in the returned results. We recommend setting this to 1 unless you have a hard requirement to make the sync faster at the expense of accuracy. The minimum allowed value for this field is 1, and the maximum is 364. Not applied to custom Cohort reports.
